occurrences.text: doesn't seem that it was extremely long that they were there in the burning, fiery furnace. But they spent more time in that burning, fiery furnace than you did. Or than I have. And it was because they were willing to stand. That they went in that burning, fiery furnace. And the reality is that as we look at this, and we think about the communion that they enjoyed, we find that the psalmist says that in Thy presence is fullness of joy. Jeremiah, of course, he's prophesying on the eve of captivity. And in fact, Jeremiah's prophesying when the Babylonians have besieged the city and he sees them all around. He understands what's going to happen. But God gives word after word to Jeremiah. And in here, in Jeremiah 42 and v. 11, the Bible says, be not afraid of the King of Babylon, of whom you are afraid. Be not afraid of Him, saith the Lord, for I am with you to save you and to deliver you from His hand. Jeremiah 42 and v. 11. Don't be afraid of Him. The One you're afraid of, don't be afraid of Him. Why? Because I'm with you. I'm with you. Man, they had some communion with God. We understand that as we look at the truth of the New Testament, Jesus said in Matthew 28 before His ascension, all power is given unto Me. He gives the great commission. And He says, lo, I am with you always.
